page.title: 01Blackmore Vale Somerset
page.content: Two villages top Blackmore VAle Somerset. Low lying grassland dominated by Coneygore and Tinkers Hills. Many springs in hills, hamstone outcrops. Extensive dairy farming,fields sometimes scattered. Some sheep pigs horses, old cider apple orchards. Two locl hunts work here. Old hedges, large deciduous trees,oak ash, sycamore,field maple. Foxes badgers, roe deer, buzzards, Older buildings hamstone,roofs tile or slate, sometimes thatch; newer buildins often reconstituted stone. Cucklington has St Lawrence Church,partlyy C13. Shanks House, C17. Village hall and sportsfield,both much used, St Andrews Church Stoke Trister, rebuit on hill C100 years ago. Stoke Trister Manor, pre-reformation, much restored. No school, shop, pub or post office in
